question.title: How to create sheet with right-to-left alignment using Apache POI XSSF

node.contents: I'm trying to create a sheet in the Excel file using Apache POI.

astNode.text: I'm trying to create a sheet in the Excel file using Apache POI.

node.contents: Since it's Excel 2007, I'm using XSSF and I'm looking a for way to make a sheet right-to-left aligned.

astNode.text: Since it's Excel 2007, I'm using XSSF and I'm looking a for way to make a sheet right-to-left aligned.

node.contents: In HSSF there is a method org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFSheet.setRightToLeft(boolean), but I cannot find it in org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet.

astNode.text: In HSSF there is a method org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFSheet.setRightToLeft(boolean), but I cannot find it in org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet.

node.contents: I got reply from the POI mailing list. It's a bit easier then your suggestion :)

astNode.text: I got reply from the POI mailing list. It's a bit easier then your suggestion :)

node.contents: I see your easier suggestion, and raise you http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1152031&view=rev :)

astNode.text: I see your easier suggestion, and raise you http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1152031&view=rev :)

node.contents: As it's not there, you'll need to do a little bit of work, sorry...

astNode.text: As it's not there, you'll need to do a little bit of work, sorry...

node.contents: First, create a simple file in excel that's left to right. Then, open a copy and set it to right to left in excel, and save. Now, unzip both files (.xlsx is a zip of xml files), and diff the xml to see what changed when right to left was set (I suspect it'll just be /sheets/sheet1.xml that changes BICBW)

astNode.text: First, create a simple file in excel that's left to right. Then, open a copy and set it to right to left in excel, and save. Now, unzip both files (.xlsx is a zip of xml files), and diff the xml to see what changed when right to left was set (I suspect it'll just be /sheets/sheet1.xml that changes BICBW)

node.contents: Once you know what XML needs changing, short term, grab the low level CT objects from POI and use those to manipulate it. For example, you might get the CTWorkSheet, and set a flag on that

astNode.text: Once you know what XML needs changing, short term, grab the low level CT objects from POI and use those to manipulate it. For example, you might get the CTWorkSheet, and set a flag on that

node.contents: Finally, report a new bug in the POI bugzilla for the missing setter/getter. Upload the two sample files, which can be used in a unit test, and include information on the XML that is changed and the CT objects that need setting. Someone can then quickly add the feature to POI. If you can, include a patch to XSSFSheet that does this too!

astNode.text: Finally, report a new bug in the POI bugzilla for the missing setter/getter. Upload the two sample files, which can be used in a unit test, and include information on the XML that is changed and the CT objects that need setting.
